headline: Feedback
pros: Amazing, respectful, flexible, understanding, awesome learning
cons: I do not have any cons

headline: Positive focused company that provides career minded employees the abilities to succeed and grow.
pros:
Working for First Commerce Bank for the past 3 years has given me opportunity to advance my career. As well as learn from experienced bankers with many proven years of service and work experience. The culture is to promote hard working employees and also promote a positive and friendly work atmosphere. Micromanagement doesn't exist here as well as well as a push for aggressive sales tactics. The bank believes in building customer relationships and helping our customers. It's true hometown community banking at First Commerce Bank and this comes from someone who has been in the industry for 20+years. First Commerce Bank is
Dedicated  to community and growing bank.
cons: I have no negative experiences to share.

headline: Great place to build your career!
pros: Positive and supportive environment, room for advancement and professional senior management who truly cares for employees.
cons: Nothing really stands out negatively.  Some small things arise but would be the same in any company.

headline: Worst banking job I have ever had in my  banking career! Don’t apply-Run!
cons: Management sucks and treats staff like dirt! Tellers are scared to death to make a mistake. Customer’s are sneaky and rude!

headline: Your soul will die here.
pros: Eh benefits. Holiday pay for all federal holidays.
cons: Management is like a headless chicken. Sorry, that's not fair to the chicken.

headline: Hostile Working Environment
pros: It's a job. Literally, that's it.
cons: Leadership promotes a hostile working environment. No one is happy.

headline: First Commerce Bank
cons: A lot of tun around in staff, not good communication from corporate to retail.

headline: Great Place to Work
pros: Always room for advancement and to learn new things. Senior Management really seems to care about their employees. Paid Holidays, and Banker's Hours.
cons: Policies are a bit vague at times.
